summary: Edit/update the existing website for KVR Hospital, Nandyal.
architectural_notes: Contact phone numbers should be updated to: 08514 220234 and 7207534210 (replace both previously listed numbers).
Ensure a full-site scan/update so the old contact number is not shown anywhere (including lower-page sections like Contact area/footer and any other components).

imageRequirements:
## Edit Images
- Replace the profile/logo image with the newly uploaded picture while removing/avoiding any visible "Cardiology" service text (kvr-hospital-profile.dim_512x512.png > kvr-hospital-profile.dim_512x512.png)

existing_features.title: Update the website to represent “KVR Hospital, Nandyal” with correct hospital identity and core contact details (address, phone numbers, email) and clear 24x7 emergency availability messaging.

Create a clear, responsive landing-page structure suitable for a hospital website, including at minimum: Hero section, About section, Specialties/Departments section, Contact section, and a Footer; ensure all user-facing text is in English.
Add prominent call-to-action interactions for calling the hospital and reaching emergency services, using tel: links for the listed phone numbers and a mailto: link for the email address.

Establish a coherent, distinctive visual theme for the hospital website (colors, typography, spacing, and component styling) and apply it consistently across sections; avoid a blue/purple color scheme unless explicitly requested by the user later.

Add basic on-page SEO and accessibility essentials for the hospital landing page: meaningful page title, meta description, semantic headings (single H1), accessible link/button labels, and sufficient color contrast for text.
Add a simple Contact section layout that displays the provided address and includes a clearly formatted “How to reach” area (text-only; no maps/geolocation integrations).

Replace both existing contact phone numbers (currently shown as “08514-247365” and “+91 9618158499”) across the landing page with the new numbers “08514 220234” and “7207534210”, including updating all corresponding tel: links.

Scan the entire frontend codebase and static HTML for any remaining occurrences of the old phone numbers (e.g., “08514-247365”, “08514 247365”, “+91 9618158499”, “9618158499”) and replace them everywhere with the correct KVR Hospital numbers: “08514 220234” and “7207534210”, including updating any corresponding tel: links.

Refactor the frontend to define the hospital contact details (phone numbers, tel: links, email, address) in a single shared constant/module and update LandingPage, ContactSection, and Footer to consume these shared values to prevent future inconsistencies.

Remove any public-facing mention of the outdated cardiology doctor name ("Dr. M. Murali Krishna") from the KVR Hospital, Nandyal website, and ensure the site does not display a specific cardiology doctor name unless a new current name is explicitly provided in code.

Add a single-source-of-truth constant for department/doctor display names (starting with Cardiology) and refactor the UI to consume that constant wherever cardiology doctor/consultant text is shown, so future updates require changing only one file.
Remove the Cardiology department from the centralized department display constants so it is no longer available to the UI.
Remove Cardiology from the Specialties/Departments UI so it is not displayed anywhere on the landing page specialties grid (including removing the Heart icon import if unused after removal).

Ensure no old/outdated contact phone numbers are displayed anywhere on the site by locating the remaining lower/bottom section still showing an old number and replacing it to use the centralized values from frontend/src/constants/hospitalContact.ts (including updating any corresponding tel: link).

Remove any remaining public-facing references that present “Cardiology” as an available specialty/department in static SEO text, including updating frontend/index.html meta description to no longer list Cardiology.

Create a new square "profile picture" logo image from the user-uploaded file "WhatsApp Image 2026-02-09 at 12.06.36.jpeg" and add it as a static asset under frontend/public/assets/generated, then update the landing page hero logo to use this new asset instead of the current "/assets/generated/kvr-hospital-logo.dim_512x512.png".

Use the new profile picture as the site favicon by adding appropriate <link rel="icon"> tag(s) in frontend/index.html that point to the generated favicon asset(s) placed in frontend/public/assets/generated.

Ensure the profile-picture image used on the site does not introduce any user-facing text that contradicts the current website content (specifically: do not show “Cardiology” as an available service/department in the profile picture).

Update the website to display the user’s latest uploaded picture as the site profile/logo image by regenerating the existing generated assets and ensuring they are the ones referenced in the UI (hero logo) and in the favicon links.

Update the site profile/logo image to reflect the newly uploaded file "WhatsApp Image 2026-02-09 at 12.06.36-1.jpeg" by regenerating the existing generated profile image asset used on the landing page hero (keep the same referenced path "/assets/generated/kvr-hospital-profile.dim_512x512.png").

Update the site favicon to reflect the newly uploaded file "WhatsApp Image 2026-02-09 at 12.06.36-1.jpeg" by regenerating the existing generated favicon asset referenced in frontend/index.html (keep the same referenced path "/assets/generated/kvr-hospital-favicon.dim_32x32.png").

Ensure the updated profile/logo image derived from "WhatsApp Image 2026-02-09 at 12.06.36-1.jpeg" does not contain any user-facing text that contradicts the current site content, specifically it must not show "Cardiology" as an available service/department.
